Atypical, see note. The smears are moderately cellular. Numerous clusters of benign ductal epithelium with myoepithelial cells are present. However, some of the groups demonstrate enlarged nuclei with mild architectural abnormality. While these findings may represent a benign hyperplastic lesion, a low grade neoplasm cannot be completely excluded. Abundant macrophages and Lipophages are sen in the background suggesting fat necrosis. Although there is a low probability for a neoplastic process, an excisional biopsy is suggested for complete histologic evaluation.
